intro: Asprella nardiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved asprella, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact growth habit. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves that are typically evergreen, providing year-round foliage. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white or pale pink during the spring and summer months. Asprella nardiformis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
